parseXml

public static org.w3c.dom.Document parseXml(java.io.File xmlFile,
                                            java.lang.Boolean isValidating)
                                     throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                            org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                            java.io.IOException

Parses an XML file into a W3C Document

Parameters:
xmlFile - File to read and parse
isValidating - Should parser be validating or forgiving
Returns:
XML document parsed from file
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If XML could not be parsed
org.xml.sax.SAXException - If XML could not be parsed
java.io.IOException - If file could not be read

                                           throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

Creates a new blank XML document with the specified root element

Parameters:
rootElementName - Name of the root element
Returns:
XML document
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If document couldn't be properly constructed

createSimpleElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element createSimpleElement(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                      java.lang.String elementName,
                                                      java.lang.String elementContent,
                                                      org.w3c.dom.Element parentElem)

Creates a new element in the document context, and optionally puts text content in as a child text element

Parameters:
doc - Document to create element in
elementName - Name of element to create
elementContent - If not null, contents will be added as a Text child of the element
parentElem - If not null, new element will be added as a child of this parent element
Returns:
Element created

prettyPrintWithTrAX

public static java.lang.String prettyPrintWithTrAX(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                                                   java.io.File configFile)
                                            throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Formats an XML org.w3c.dom Document into a pretty-printed String.

"pretty-print" means proper line breaks, indenting, spacing, etc, so a single-line XML mess becomes human readable

Cribbed from http://www.chipkillmar.net/2009/03/25/pretty-print-xml-from-a-dom/

Parameters:
document - org.w3c.dom Document to convert
configFile - XSLT file that dictates how to convert the document
Returns:
Pretty-print formatted String of document
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - if config file or document couldn't be parsed

prettyPrintWithTrAX

public static java.lang.String prettyPrintWithTrAX(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document configDocument)
                                            throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Formats an XML org.w3c.dom Document into a pretty-printed String.

"pretty-print" means proper line breaks, indenting, spacing, etc, so a single-line XML mess becomes human readable

Cribbed from http://www.chipkillmar.net/2009/03/25/pretty-print-xml-from-a-dom/

Parameters:
document - org.w3c.dom Document to convert
configDocument - XSLT document that dictates how to convert the document
Returns:
Pretty-print formatted String of document
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If one of the documents could not be parsed

prettyPrintWithTrAX

public static java.lang.String prettyPrintWithTrAX(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
                                            throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException,
                                                   javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

Formats an XML org.w3c.dom Document into a pretty-printed String.

"pretty-print" means proper line breaks, indenting, spacing, etc, so a single-line XML mess becomes human readable

Cribbed from http://www.chipkillmar.net/2009/03/25/pretty-print-xml-from-a-dom/

Note that a default "pretty-print" XSLT document will be created for the conversion. This is normally fine for most applications.

Parameters:
document - Document to convert
Returns:
Pretty-print formatted String of document
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If document couldn't be parsed
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If document couldn't be parsed

GeneratePrettyPrintDocument

public static org.w3c.dom.Document GeneratePrettyPrintDocument()
                                                        throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

Generates a default "pretty-print" XSLT document for use in converting Documents.

"pretty-print" means proper line breaks, indenting, spacing, etc, so a single-line XML mess becomes human readable

Returns:
Document representing a "pretty-print" XSLT that dictates how to convert another document
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If document couldn't be built

prettyPrintWithTrAX

public static java.lang.String prettyPrintWithTrAX(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document prettyPrintDocument)
                                            throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Formats an XML org.w3c.dom Node into a pretty-printed String.

"pretty-print" means proper line breaks, indenting, spacing, etc, so a single-line XML mess becomes human readable

Cribbed from http://www.chipkillmar.net/2009/03/25/pretty-print-xml-from-a-dom/

Parameters:
node - Node to convert
prettyPrintDocument - org.w3c.dom Document representing a "pretty-print" XSLT that dictates how to convert the document
Returns:
Pretty-print formatted String of document
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If document could not be read

Formats an XML org.w3c.dom Node into a pretty-printed String.

node - Node to convert
Returns:
Pretty-print formatted String of document

getNodesFromXPath

public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> getNodesFromXPath(org.w3c.dom.Node context,
                                                                 java.lang.String xpath)
                                                          throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Returns all the nodes selected by the given xpath

Returns a List instead of a NodeList so that things like Iterators will work as expected.

Parameters:
context - Node to begin search at
xpath - XPath expression to evaluate
Returns:
List of Nodes matching XPath expression
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If XML selection fails

getStringFromXPath

public static java.lang.String getStringFromXPath(org.w3c.dom.Node context,
                                                  java.lang.String xpath)
                                           throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Gets a string value from a document using a given XPath

If the xpath resolves to a text node or an attribute node, the return value will be the node value for that node.

For any other node type, this will attempt to get the first child of the node (assuming that is the textual value for the node), and return that child's value.

Parameters:
context - Node to search within
xpath - XPath statement to evaluate
Returns:
String value selected from the XML
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If XML selection fails

getLongFromXPath

public static java.lang.Long getLongFromXPath(org.w3c.dom.Node context,
                                              java.lang.String xpath)
                                       throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Searches XML for a String value, and then attempts to convert that to a Long value.

If the xpath resolves to a text node or an attribute node, the return value will be the node value for that node.

For any other node type, this will attempt to get the first child of the node (assuming that is the textual value for the node), and return that child's value.

Parameters:
context - Document or node to search in
xpath - XPath statement to evaluate
Returns:
Long representing String value found by XPath
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - If XML selection fails

getIntegerFromXPath

public static java.lang.Integer getIntegerFromXPath(org.w3c.dom.Node context,
                                                    java.lang.String xpath)
                                             throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Searches XML for a String value, and then attempts to convert that to an Integer value.

If the xpath resolves to a text node or an attribute node, the return value will be the node value for that node.

For any other node type, this will attempt to get the first child of the node (assuming that is the textual value for the node), and return that child's value.

Parameters:
context - Document or node to search in
xpath - XPath statement to evaluate
Returns:
Integer representing String value found by XPath
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

public static java.lang.Boolean getBooleanFromXPath(org.w3c.dom.Node context,
                                                    java.lang.String xpath)
                                             throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Searches XML for a String value, and then attempts to convert that to a Boolean value.

If the xpath resolves to a text node or an attribute node, the return value will be the node value for that node.

For any other node type, this will attempt to get the first child of the node (assuming that is the textual value for the node), and return that child's value.

Parameters:
context - Document or node to search in
xpath - XPath statement to evaluate
Returns:
Boolean representing String value found by XPath
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

extractXmlFromString

public static org.w3c.dom.Element extractXmlFromString(java.lang.String xml)
                                                throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                       org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                       java.io.IOException

Builds an XML Element from a String containing XML

Parameters:
xml - String with XML to parse
Returns:
Element representing XML passed in
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If XML could not be parsed
org.xml.sax.SAXException - If XML could not be parsed
java.io.IOException - If String could not be read
